Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2012 09:05PM nsmith36 wrote: Hi Pinkpearl: I had the same thing happen to me some time ago and the reason they sometimes have get a better look is due to "dense breast tissue" which I also have. They had to do spot compressions where the breast tissue was dense.The Drs called me back many times to " get a better look" even in my 20's. I was diagnosed in 2007 with breast cancer. After much Chemo and Raiation I and am happy to report that I am getting ready to celebrate my 5 years of survival.  Please try not to worry for it won't change a thing and it will just make you crazy.
Posts.Title: Worried to death!!! Pinkpearl39 Pinkpearl39

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2012 02:30AM nsmith36 wrote: Nanc: No, you are not being over sensitive. They should be doing everything to make you comfortable at this scary uncertain time. My office had snacks, special hand kniitted blankets etc. Look around cause you don't HAVE to go to that place. The nurses need to make you feel at ease as much as possible. If you don't get a good feeling about it go somewhere else if you can or at least visit some others. .
Posts.Title: Choosing the "right" place for chemo... Nanc620 ruthbru
